page.title: 12TYPICAL SCHOOL DAY
page.content: Our school day at Flamstead begins at 9.00am when the whistle is blown.We then go into school and take our coats off and line up for assembly.The assembly is taken by Mr.Hickling or Mr.Bates.After assembly the juniors usually do maths until break at 10.40am when we go into the field if the weather is good.The infants have milk at this time.After break we do English until lunchtime.Most children stay for school lunch.We have a choice of about 3 menus and have our lunch in the assembly hall.In the afternoon we do all sorts of different things,such as topic work,swimming or games.We go home at 3.15pm but we have clubs after school like gym club and pottery club. Older children go to school in Hemel Hempstead and don't get home until 4.15pm.
